rtega_mnemonic:
啚啚RS鄙𠴿𠷰low, mean, cheap, small heap of grains
  • RS. Primitive pictograph → 啚: a heap of wheat sheaves 㐭 and an enclosure 口: thrifty, cheap
  • people in the city 阝 with a small heap of grain 啚: lowly and cheap people
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 啚 indicates the sound; 阝 (village) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: Despicable people who use needles to inject drugs are banished beyond the city walls so they can't return and influence the young people with words from their mouths.

humanum_short_description_en: " Rustic " at the beginning of the text as " Bi ", see " Bi ." "Shuowen": "Five entanglements are contemptible. Cry from the town." Duan Yucai's note: "Today I am contemptuous and scorn it."
humanum_short_description: 「鄙」之初文作「啚」，參見「啚」。《說文》：「五酇爲鄙。从邑啚聲。」段玉裁注：「今則鄙行而啚廢矣。」

鄙字的基本解释

鄙
bǐ
中国周代地方组织单位之一，五百家为一鄙：鄙师（古官名，周制每县五鄙，“鄙师”掌其鄙之政令祭祀）。
郊野之处，边远的地方：边鄙。
粗俗：鄙陋。鄙俗。鄙夫。鄙近（庸俗浅近）。
轻蔑，看不起：鄙视。鄙夷。鄙弃。鄙薄。
品质低劣：卑鄙。
谦辞，用于自称：鄙人。鄙老。鄙见。
吝啬：鄙吝。鄙诈（贪吝诈伪）。

鄙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bǐ］
［《廣韻》方美切，上旨，幫。］
“啚1”的今字。
(1)周代地方行政单位。王城郊外以五百家为“鄙”。
(2)采邑；小邑。
(3)边邑；边境。
(4)郊野；郊外。
(5)谓退处于野。
(6)狭小。
(7)粗俗；质朴。
(8)浅陋；低贱。
(9)鄙视；轻蔑。
(10)以为羞耻。
(11)贪吝。
(12)蔽固，不通达。
(13)鄙人。自称的谦词。
(14)用在名词前，用以谦称自己或与自己有关的事物。参见“鄙心”、“鄙言”、“鄙臣”、“鄙土”。

鄙字的英文翻译

◎ 鄙
low, mean, despicable, my, despise, scorn

鄙字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【邑字部】　鄙； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1276第18
〔古文〕?【廣韻】方美切【集韻】【韻會】補美切【正韻】補委切，?音比。【釋名】鄙，否也。小邑不能遠通也。【周禮·天官·大宰】以八則治都鄙。【註】都之所居曰鄙，公卿大夫之采邑，王子弟所食邑在畿內者。又【地官·遂人】掌造縣鄙形體之法，五酇爲鄙，五鄙爲縣。　又【廣韻】邊鄙也。【左傳·隱元年】太叔命西鄙北鄙貳于己。【註】鄙，鄭邊邑。　又【正韻】陋也，厭薄之也。【左傳·宣十四年】過我而不假道，鄙我也。【老子·道德經】衆人皆有以，我獨頑似鄙。　又鄙與都對言，朴野也。【淮南子·詮言訓】夫始于都者，常大于鄙。　又鄙與仁對，言不通也。【前漢·董仲舒傳】或仁或鄙。　又嗇於財者曰鄙吝。　俗作鄙、?。

考證：〔【老子·道德經】衆人皆有以，我獨頑且鄙。〕　謹照原文且改似。
鄙字的源字形

鄙字的起名意思

暂无。

rustic
Basic explanation of words
rustic
bǐ
One of the local organization units in the Zhou Dynasty in China, five hundred companies are one baishi: Bashi (ancient official name, five counties per county in the week system, "Bianshi" holds the decree and worship of Qi Bian).
Countryside, remote place: Biandi.
Vulgar: contemptuous. vulgar. your humble servant. Contemptuous (vulgar and shallow).
Contempt, look down: Contempt. disdain. disdain. scorn.
Poor quality: despicable.
Modesty, used to claim to be: my dear. Despise the old. my humble opinion.
Stingy: stingy. Contempt (greed and deceit).
rustic
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bǐ］
["Guangyun" Fang Meiqie, decree, help. ]
The present word for "啚1".
(1) Zhou Dynasty local administrative unit. In the suburbs of Wangcheng, five hundred houses are regarded as "despicable".
(2) Feiyi; Xiaoyi.
(3) Bianyi; border.
(4) The countryside; the outskirts.
(5) It is said that the retiring is in the wild.
(6) Narrow and small.
(7) Vulgar; rustic.
(8) Shallow; humble.
(9) Contempt; contempt.
(10) Be ashamed.
(11) Greedy.
(12) Concealed and impassive.
(13) My dear. The self-proclaimed modest word.
(14) Used in front of nouns, to humbly refer to oneself or things related to oneself. See also "contempt", "contempt", "contempt", "contempt".
rustic

low, mean, despicable, my, despise, scorn

[You Ji 2] [Yi Zi Department] 　 Mi; Kangxi strokes: 18; Page number: page 1276 18
[Ancient text]? [Guangyun] Fang Meiqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Supplementary Meiqie [Zhengyun] Supplementary rhyme, and sound ratio. [Release name] Despicable, no. Xiaoyi can't go far. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】Eight rules are all contemptuous. [Note] The residence of the capital is said to be dirty, the benevolence of the doctor of the public, and the prince’s brother’s food is in the Guinei. Also 【Landguan·Suiren】The method of palming the county to despise the body, the five cons are the contempt, and the five cons are the county.　[Guang Yun] Bian Bei also. [Zuo Zhuan·Yin First Year] Uncle Tai ordered the West to despise the North and despise him. [Note] Bian, Zheng Bianyi.　[Zheng Yun] It’s too shabby, and it’s too thin. [Zuo Zhuan·Xuan Fourteen Years] Pass me without pretending, despise me. [Laozi·Tao De Jing] Everyone knows it, but I am stubborn and contemptuous.　And both contemptuous and both spoke to each other, Pu Ye also. [Huainanzi·Explanation of Words] Husbands start from the capital, and are often greater than despicable.　Be contemptuous and benevolent, but they don’t make sense. [Previous Han·Dong Zhongshu Biography] either benevolent or contemptuous.　The one who succumbed to the wealth again said to be stingy.　Vulgar and contemptuous,?
